Posts.Content: Hi there,  Im no expert on the sentinel node biopsy but just thought I'd share that I had exactly the same op as you last Wednesday.  I had reconstruction at the same time and also had a lump under my arm.  They removed two out ofthe three levels of lymph nodes.  I must say they have done a great job and I haven't been in much pain at all. II've just been taking paracetamol and ibuprofen.  I think that they do a sentinel node biopsy when they don't already know if the nodes are affected during a mastectomy or lumpectomy and then if that is positive they go back and remove all nodes but as I say im no expert. Anyway good luck tomorrow and it really wasn't as bad as expected.  Rachel
Posts.Title: what is sentinal node biopsy?

Posts.Content: Hi there,   I have been thinking of having my ovaries removed and am going to discuss it again tomorrow with my oncologist.  She mentioned about having zoladex injections but I'm 33 and you can only have them for 2 years so im thinking removal of my ovaries may be more long term but she said there are disadvantages doing this so young.  I am hoping to have the gene test and if I carry the gene will definitely have everything removed!  Take care everyone Rachel xxx
Posts.Title: OVARY REMOVAL ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Good morning everyone thankyou for messages and comments ladt night had total meltdown much ti my husbands disgust as he doesnt really do emotion typical north eastbloke, i had to go bsck to hospital twice yesterday to have area of recon stiched again as not healing,they are worried about an infection that if it happens will have to take out inplant possibly, they have given me heavy dose antibiotics and last night my freind drove me and my daughter to brownie camp on returning i went into a shivering fit and could not get warm had three duvets and my son in bed with me dont know if was delayed shock ? all just got too much and i am 9days post surgery and i lost the plot, as they found cells in lymph node that was compatible with breast cancer did lymph node clerance as part of masectomy my consultant said as i have or had such a large breast cup size f to g was a huge operation, i am worried that because callscwere found in biopsy that it has allready spread to other parts of body i get my histolgy results on thursday so stil not sure what i am dealing with,first biopsy showed dcis in ductalbbut as tgey said there must be something more to spread to lymph my breast care nurse said surgeon had felt a tumour but no idea to size or anything else , my head has had it and i am normally pretty level headed but this is all too much, if it is in lymph nodes does it all ways spread?
Posts.Title: whats next help heads had it

Posts.Content: hi Anne marie i am glad that you have finished your chemo and feeling more normal i cant wait to be at that stage i had my second fec on wed seem to be handeling ok no sickness just headaches but my prob is hair trying to cling onto that for me and my kids but they are prob not as bothered as me, your son will have enjoyed yesterday as i feel mine are missing out as we had to canx our holiday and following diagonosis and masectomy also three fec/tax and rads to follow seems like journey never ending !!!!!! which one did you find worse and dud you use a cold cap sorry for all the questions hope you dont mind  linda xx
Posts.Title: For anyone about to start or going through chemo.....

Posts.Content: hi ethel i hope you have a lovely holiday you will have a ball with this weather, i ope my kids dont look back and remember this badly they are dussapointed as i am sure your sone was that they are not going to gran canaria as i am, they seem to be ok though which is better than expected , i miss swimming as canx my gym membership before surgery , i am also using the cold cap but thinning after session two so i hope thats just it and not that it is not working  heres wishing you goid weather  linda
Posts.Title: For anyone about to start or going through chemo.....

Posts.Content: Hi, I add ffresh tumeric to my juice every day for it's anti cancer properties and put lot's of black pepper on everything!  Don't know if it helps aches and pains but worth a go!
Posts.Title: Tumeric and aches and pains

Posts.Content: Thank you all for your help xx I have been feeling tired but that could be anything. I had a scan before chemo so 1 year ago which was fine and i had a colonoscopy after chemo to rule out bowel cancer because of the raised cea before chemo. I do get strange feelings on my right side, not pain, which ive had since i started chemo but were worse thsn they are now and they come and go. I dont know im just feeling so scared all over again and was doing so well getting on with life. Will just have to wait and see x
Posts.Title: CEA level 15 so had CT scan today. Anyone else had this?e

Posts.Content: Hi, I haven't been on here for in a bit of a panic today as went to see surgeon for first year check up and mamagram results and he sent me for CT scan as my cea level is 15. It was high before I started chemo but then came down to normal and now high again. Has anyone else experienced this? My ca153 is normal along with everything else.
Posts.Title: CEA level 15 so had CT scan today. Anyone else had this?e

Posts.Content: i am also new to this i was diagonosed two weeks ago and last/wed had a masectomy with skin sparing reconstruction back home now and has all happened so fastva month ago i was going to work as normal and bang this came along, now just have to wait for histology results going to be a long week , and of course another bank holiday so has extended by a day , i told my two kids 9 & 10 after conformation of date and they handled better than expected,my son a bit more clingy than normal but on the whole okay from day of first appointment to actually going to therter i was in a bit of a world of my own and a bit of denial but i knew after surgery it would be a reality,
Posts.Title: New to the Group

Posts.Content: Hi there,  I had similar surgery a couple of weeks ago and my underarm is very sore. I had 2 drains in and the second will be removed tomorrow.  My cut for the lymph nodes is quite far down my side rather that under my armpit so have been able to wash with a flannel as I have waterproof dressings on. I have been a lot more positive since my op but worried about getting my results tomorrow.  Keep strong it will get better. My mum had the same op as me 17 years ago and she has been fine since. Im only 32 so feel upset that im going through this so young.   Rachel x
Posts.Title: Results.....waiting and sore!!!
